adm7B4ywLM_pOjnRHWwJYQ.text: Very bland all around. Over-done steak. Putting wet, shredded chicken in a corn tortilla doesn't make sense to me. I gave this place a second chance and am regretting it! I don't get the hype of this restaurant.

Uw1eYAoeo1hYvf7rrto4zA.text: The food was actually pretty good, the service and restaurant itself, meh.  The food took over 25 minutes to arrive; 25 minutes for a taco salad and a burrito. The floors were dirty, the busing and cleaning of empty tables was almost non-existent.  Half of the empty tables had food from the previous customer on them and no one was cleaning them. There is a salad-bar like set-up to choose the kind of salsa you wanted; it was so disgusting with spillage that we just passed on touching anything there.  I will give it another month to work out the kinks.  I really do hope it improves but I was not impressed at all with my first visit.

g19TUK5DMdXs_nTBprqAWA.text: Wow what a disappointment.  Went Sunday late morning. Not crowded at all.  Girl at register was slow and didn't understand the system.  Had to repeat a simple order multiple times.    Waited over 30 minutes and never received order.  We were told multiple time 5 minutes.  Hard to explain to a Hungary 6 year old. Finally got disgusted and got a refund.   We were given a gift card however.   Will not return. Giving the gift card to the friend who recommended the place.   The food I saw being delivered looked pretty good though. Went to Harris Teeter and got some pizza.  Pretty good.

T8mAJQvfiIsa7epl1s6qjA.text: Ordered our food 35 minutes ago... still waiting...  noisy...  dirty... server with bad attitude...  before tasting my food I can already say I won't be back !!!  OK so we got our food, we'll some of it, Horrible!!  Save your money.

sLCfSdDV3QCuD2DTVyrldg.text: Waited 20 minutes in line for a to go order and moved 5 feet.  Left extremely frustrated and confused.  It was as if each person was cooking their own food...get it together guys, or you won't make it...

7PU6lPTHQJCohd6V-EQzWA.text: Started out great now portion size has decreased. Bar helps and service is good. Add cheese to tacos only ten cent!

feBppG9vpFehlNCs1msFpw.text: I am a frequent customer of Sabor and I've been to almost every location they have and I've loved them all. This one is closet to my home, so I was super excited to try it. Placed a to go order and had to call several times before the phone was even answered. I placed my order and was told that it would take ten minutes. I arrived in 15 minutes, paid, then had to wait another 15 minutes to receive my good. I ordered chips with my food and didn't receive it and had to wait another 5 minutes on that. To top it all off, the employees, especially the guy running the register, weren't even friendly. Things happen, but the one thing you can always provide is friendly service and I didn't even receive that. I will not be returning to this location.

0IWoC47Z3VMPcasxOclFiQ.text: Food is tasty. Service at the bar is consistently inconsistent.  Bartenders are very nice but poorly trained. The last 3 times we have been there for taco Tuesdays,  orders have been wrong.

Ik0yJ5DULrPnanWIZ4xMHw.text: Excellent food and super fresh! I've repeatedly gotten the Quinoa Avocado Bowl- amazing. I love the salsa bar too!

xxK97OspeAU4ikAw1RBVCA.text: Typical Tex-Mexish.  Good flavor and big portions.  We went in for a late lunch and there was a few people ahead of us, but by the time we sat down there was a line to the door.  Be patient for your food.  Service is friendly, decor industrial.

plYe8sX_gakuvORzOG8-VQ.text: Very disappointing, after waiting for 30 minutes plus for our tacos we were told the cook lost our order, most disorganized restaurant I've ever been to. The tacos and queso are pretty good but doubt I will go back unless their service issues are improved.

5m1G9UV9hWytF2VM2cbk7A.text: I was expecting to have a new fav. Taco place, but was very disappointed. Soggy, floppy chips, no seasoning to be found in our nearly 50 dollar order, bland salsas, the tortillas are very poorly made and fall apart easily. I do have to give credit to the perfectly fried empanada dough, But the filling was completely void of flavor. The atmosphere of the place is not great either. The line for ordering is smack dab inbetween the pick up window for servers and the tables, and im sure the servers are just as annoyed as the patrons for having to fight through a small herd of people to deliver food. Not to mention the bulidings great acoustics, loud music and screaming workers. I left hungry and with ringing ears. I would have tried a cocktail, but the bartender was very busy with other tasks and hardly at the bar. Ill be sticking with Tequlias in Rock Hill.

3NVWP4yi0BSdRo0TUDMw3w.text: I was looking forward to trying this restaurant ever since I saw the "Coming Soon!" sign out front.  The only word that I can I've for my first meal experience at Sabor is disappointing.  Not only is the price double what it should be,  I was unaware that you could make a bad burrito.  It was as dry as concrete even when dunked in sauce and the flavor was missing.  I will be going back to give this place a second chance.  I hope my opinion will change upon a second try.  However, based in my first meal I not not recommend staying away strongly enough.  Just go to Charanda of Fort Mill.

CfgLOSCBdEB8GnS5MHPWUQ.text: First visit and was not overly impressed.  One guy taking orders and about 25 people in line was not an efficient process.  Wifey and I ordered the BYOB burrito bowl and although the taste was just ok, the portions were so small both my wife and I left hungry.  Leaving hungry from a Mexican/Latin restaurant you say?  Exactly.  And in most similar type establishments you order a burrito and they throw in a handful of chips.  Not here.  I found myself stealing my kids chips for salsa dipping, irritating everybody.  Also, my daughter's taco shell looked like one I can buy at the local Walmart.  Yum.  On the plus side it seemed they had a decent selection of the local brews, albeit what everybody else has.  We will probably try it again on a low risk kids eat free night but I suspect the results will be similar.  Definitely will not be dropping that much $$ again and having to go home to get the 2nd course.

fJJ60HItmhDfZRccze9myw.text: best latin street food in the area. queso is fantastic as are the tacos! pineapple habanero salsa is made fresh every day.

TAQ73s0BLWgxd_Bk4XkPaw.text: I've been to Sabor numerous times since they opened the location in FM/Tega Cay. Fresh and tasty food - a welcome alternative to the ubiquitous Tex-Mex chains and franchises. Managing the lines during lunch still seems to be a challenge as it can take longer than reasonably expected. Nonetheless, a welcomed addition to the area. Will be back many more times.

WofcsGuEOzGd-7OqgUCDFg.text: Fantastic food and great customer service. Very good portions. Will be coming here often.

y11Qe5SwkfokDGSjqQ_Gcg.text: From the guys that brought you Three Amigos Mexican Grill comes the new crack of Latin Charlotte restaurants. It's fast. It's cheap. It's fresh. And as Dora the Explorer would say it's Delisciouso! Sorry my Spanish speaking friends if I butchered that.  I love these restaurants! I'm so glad one opened up near me! Great Arepas and plantains. I ask for mine extra crispy and plain. Super quick, super yummy! You can't go wrong. Now live a little and give this Latin street food a try. You won't be sorry.

5Q9rPgfpESWWANYteoOBqA.text: From the ashes of "Burger Craft" comes "Sabor"! Fan-flipping-tastic! This has become one of our top local places. Much like it's other locations, it's more of a counter-service place. It has tables and a bar area. Great Hispanic food with a modern healthy eating twist. Throw in some craft beers and we have a winner!

Ctwid88KEZc6z-B8n3YHDQ.text: The food was ok but not great. Although the food was visually appealing, it was rather bland. I most likely will not be back.

RY4inCYoy_s-8VmJZDu2Sg.text: Waited 30 min for a to-go order which, unbeknownst to me, sat idle on the counter for over 20 min while the abundant staff chitchatted. I'll choose a different location in the future.

pyK-hdQq7jjFB_syak8kYg.text: Food is pretty legit, service can get a little weird at some points. Just a little unorganized sometimes. But overall I really enjoy this place. Get the large queso just do it, you deserve it.

beWG2NKk7dh6SplU7G0AfQ.text: So happy Sabor expanded to Fort Mill!!! Love their food- this location is as good as their Charlotte locations! It is a must have!!

A8Dkya07XgDGJ6KKdiVAwQ.text: I grew up in Central America as an American citizen, and I really have to say, I  become so nostalgic every time I go there. People have to understand this restaurant is new in Fort Mill! Please give them a break!!! They have great food and a fun atmosphere. We have seen families enjoy their time together there. Every time my husband and I have gone there, there has been a line but is that BAD?? To me that means that the food is worth the wait!! It's no different than any other restaurant I've gone to that offers good food. I'm excited that there's a Latino restaurant so close to home, and it has become our favorite in the area.

Ssmgqx_3qX6c1OusurMhhg.text: The food here is really great! Fort Mill needed a good Latin food place. This hits the spot!

ab7zc4g26kev8VIJ6PmJvw.text: We were excited to try this new restaurant in the Fort Mill area, unfortunately we left extremely disappointed.  The set up is very similar to a Moe's where you walk up and place your order except there is a full bar.  While the menu choices looked great, the food was very bland and not worth the money.  Even their salsa was not very memorable.  We like supporting local businesses but the food at the big chains is far better than Sabor.

HvAUNJN2xvIEdpyPVjrH6w.text: Friendly staff and not to be dramatic, but if you think the food is "too salty," you may just need a little more seasoning in your life. I had never been here before and the guy that took my order was very nice and tried to help me pick something and was very patient (I'm the most indecisive person ever). Thank you!

AqLQmgcZpwUh9_QZ5MFu_Q.text: I'm shocked to see the negative reviews. We've been twice and it was awesome. I've had the taco salad, chorizo empanada and my fav, the churros and ice cream. It's all great. The service is okay, but the management is fantastic. They have always stepped up when there were mistakes. I'm hoping this place does well.

aSifCeb3Y52mhsaKEVi7Bg.text: Great, easy accessible location, roomy inside, good menu choices, reasonable pricing, have really enjoyed everything weve had on several trips, empanadas are amazing, must get the street corn!....love the several salsa bar options (especially pineapple habanero!, and mean green), only improvement i could say, would be bigger writing on menu over counter, very tough to read (and ive got 20/20 vision!)

hMDQWO-ItYlzfiTbPETISA.text: Solid food. Great salsa options and customer service from all staff was good. Quinoa avocado bowl was tasty. The boys enjoyed their BYOBs.

NydKKe5Duq4OPYNBxKKA3Q.text: There's a bar! Craft beer. Everything is fresh and hot off the grill. Great, fresh made empanadas (recommend along with yucca fries). Kid friendly, plenty of parking. We're regulars.

Uo0d4aEhTbED1zUW4k4fow.text: Expensive for what you get, better off going to Los Aztecas. I had the pork carnitas and it did not have the seasoning or tenderness that I expected. Have been here twice and not impression with quality of food. Lacks taste and consistency.

aHsi6cVYwAR3UG-WEheyNA.text: Not sure where the lower reviews came in for Sabor, this place serves great food and my portion is always huge, usually making for 2 meals. We are so lucky to have a place like this in Fort Mill! I've gone to the Elizabeth location near work uptown for years and it's always packed for lunch. I always get the El Dominicano and guacamole and it's always delicious. The salsa bar is awesome and offers several fresh salsas. The decor is also pretty cool and I love the bar area - plan to come here for low key date nights. So glad you're here, Sabor!

ir0ET1icwPONd6zJ2ps18A.text: Happy hour is really good. $1 tacos $3 beer. Beef taco was good so is the shredded chick taco. Best place in town for happy hour.

qxxkCSq2jA56K_ungN_RcQ.text: I love Sabor but this location is awful.  We have been multiple times because we kept thinking it would get better because it was newly opened.  It definitely didn't, it's terrible.  The customer service is awful. We waited 30 minutes in line when other registers were available.  They hardly put any meat at all in any entree.  My husband had to return his burrito because he couldn't find any meat inside.  I had to return my Taco Salad a different time for the same issue.  The other times I have went I paid extra for extra meat and they still didn't hardly put any in.  We finally went back to the other Sabor at Steele creek and it was amazing!! They really need to hire different management.

V8fumf_d4Y-BhDuOcMDrvw.text: I love grabbing a protein or burrito bowl here. It's a goto for our work lunches.  I would skip the margarita. Think they used fresh lime which my group was not a fan of.

xzUKn1aMJNbfm6a7Map3dg.text: I am a bit surprised with the amount of negative reviews because we are heading back from our first dinner at Sabor and loved it! The salsas were flavorful (much more than Moe's) and the chips were super fresh and crispy. We both got the protein bowl and thought it was delicious. Hardly any wait for the food but it was a Monday. I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States

Cn_ZoDRzpNCT-004KNvzmA.text: I love the Sabor locations in Charlotte and since I just moved to Tega Cay I was excited to discover they have a location in Fort Mill. The ones in Charlotte, especially NoDa, have such limited seating that you can't find a place to sit! In the Fort Mill location there is PLENTY of seating. So nice. The food was so good and speedily produced. I did go on a Tuesday afternoon so it may be different on a Friday night but I could not find anything to complain about! Love this place and will be going back many times!

ImAL2JwJ0qbheX0WWmgX8A.text: Sabor has great food, but this location has very slow service.  Waited over an hour, well worth drive to South Tyron alternate location for those in South Charlotte.

50Wd2y3wVFuOAXBBMKtwCg.text: Went to eat here on Thursday night with my family. The food was yummy and service was absolutely great!

0v6zjjSvyy39b64KdrTQeA.text: Was so excited when I heard tega cay was getting a sabor. I used to go to the uptown location all the time when I worked uptown. This place is amazing and if you are on a health kick you are in luck my friend. Quinoa Avocado bowl is amazing, add some shrimp and you have just upped the game. Not on a diet, good lord please do yourself a favor and get the nachos or empanadas! Carne Asada fries also take this game to another level. Right now they just have beer and wine! (Tons of local craft beers)  They have applied for the liquor license and we will soon be having margaritas with our food. Lastly, don't forget to stop by the salsa bar before you eat and grab some salsas to add flavor! Pineapple habanero salsa is the shiznick!  That's all for now! No go get you some good good! You won't be sorry!

828Nl0_iWIpvb3GOdf599g.text: Both me and my fiance became very sick for 24hrs after eating the burrito especiale.  I've eaten here a few times and it seems each time quality had went down.. this time,  I had a feeling I shouldn't eat it, it was poorly made and the chicken was actually cold.  Learned my lesson, one less place to go for burritos

IWKJ-dpNobZLTkcf2Up-DA.text: What a neat place. Food is fresh, price is great. Atmosphere casual. Love the Chorizo Empanada.

Jvxz39u3d-yekmwaaUNSig.text: OMG, I absolutely love Sabor ... they have good authentic tacos that are made with fresh ingredients. My ultimate favorite! You will truly enjoy!

iBSIh5TZXg5dLz07wAPn0g.text: The ordering process seemed slow and inefficient. One cashier and a line of at least 8 people is crazy.   For me, the food was okay. The interior was okay.   I will probably go again to see if the service is better and to try a different item.

Ggo-ln6uDgfbqNGLLrm9mQ.text: I came back to this location after frequenting on and off for the better part of a year. I was double charged, the manager "David" told me that he was too busy to correct it and that my credit card company would sort it out! It was your mistake! Along with that, the order was incorrect and the food couldn't have been more tasteless. After getting into it again with "David", he told us to "just go somewhere else and they didn't want our kind of business anyway". Appreciate it sir, I'll definitely take my business elsewhere.

XVECqA9mTw4EAYjwRTQFxA.text: Sabor is the perfect fast casual restaurant for Tega Cay.  Food as been great every visit but i have never been during a rush hour.  Prices could be a touch lower to make this an even more frequented place but overall it's pretty good.

z2x7Rj3TVqMCYRQ9OWsXTw.text: Update:  We have come back three times to dine in since my last review and it has been MUCH better with the service!  We have always sat at the bar, and every time we have been greeted and served quickly and have been taken care of wonderfully.  Bartenders have been good about checking on us without hovering.  The staff also seems to get along with each other really well and have fun while still doing a good job.  I am hoping to update this to 5 stars once we try take-out again, but I just wanted you guys to know how much we have noticed an improvement when we have gone to dine-in!

yt9SO-lW8ZuPx3_tHylsCg.text: Great tacos and burritos - very reasonable  Can be lots of kids  Phil - the bartender is awesome - old rocker (obvious), makes great margaritas

1ZGjDZBMnXungkwjmkXlWw.text: This place was great. The tacos were delicious, and the LOCO. The street corn was pretty amazing as well. Will definitely be back.

vbxMD2wRpeU_WrOhyUl69w.text: We moved recently close to this area and this has become one of it favorite places for our family. Food, atmosphere and service are great. It's a keeper!

3sxO_UzCwZBvF6oxXisxBg.text: This place is amazing especially for Taco Tuesday!! They do every very well and you can tell the GM/owner and has a lot of positive energy with his staff which always makes me happy see.

TnZwhshYtwS0zXFIDEu6ww.text: The food is legit, the portions are much larger than I expected and definitely larger than other places like it.  Service is great.  Prices are good.  The tv situation could use some help.  The restaurant is in need of a deep cleaning, just as the previous burger joint in this location.

Pg7X3RPTQff4-ytH020zjQ.text: APPALLING!!   $9 for a burrito that was almost all beans and rice. Barely any meat despite the up charge. To make matters worse, we went there because my 10 year old son is gluten intolerant and Mexican is one of the few foods he can still enjoy. We told the server, checked the queso didn't have any form of gluten in, asked to make a note on our order so the preparers would be careful for cross contamination. She reassured us she would take care of it. Two hours later my son was doubled over with stomach cramps and had to take the next two days off school. Really sad to see a 10 year old suffer like that just because a restaurant was so careless. Show less

h-_8Y3QUz2cDSkVlnoh_Yw.text: this place is very hit and miss but when the food comes out right it's great. I have had multiple dishes come out either wrong or improperly cooked, such as rice so raw it's crunchy. But like I said it's a gamble, either good or not so good.

IHAm5jLckypdxDO_nm4Rpg.text: Just OK.  I was expecting a bit more flavor and spice.  Service was fast and friendly.  Tacos were expensive, and I'm glad I went on taco Tuesday.  I wouldn't pay $4.95 for each pork taco.

photos.caption: Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Chips and Large Queso
Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Al Pastor Authentico

v7I_Hy5M_5OceTR6icEWAg.text: This was my first time going to Latin St., Grill it was really good love the authentic tacos deathly going to be going back it was also happy hour so beer and the tacos was dollar

photos.caption: Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Tacos

JBbnknikDaxOvOnsuQCNZA.text: The food is a five.  The service is a 1.  Good thing they have great food or we would never come back.  The last time I called an order in.  They said 20 minutes.  45 minutes later they finally had it ready.  Not to mention the individual who answered the phone and took my order seemed to be bothered that I called.   Same lack of speed when you dine in as well.  In addition to being slow we have had issues with not having all of our order brought out.   That being said the  empanadas, tacos and nachos are fantastic.

XuxOeb8ldVGaHU_Juwbskg.text: So, it's kitschy and fun. The decor and ambiance are worth the trip and the drinks are good. The food is also fun, if a little lacking. I'm a big fan of street food on a normal day, but at $30+ for a handful of mediocre empanadas and nearly inedible carne asada fries, I'm...disappointed, to say the least. The beef empanadas are much better than the chorizo, but they were all a bit too crunchy for my liking. The saice, though? I like that. Everything LOOKS spectacular, but there isn't nearly enough flavor to match the appearance. All in all, not the worst thing I've eaten today, but not my favorite.

b5U-uxbKRCEtrkoKv9MExQ.text: Love, love , love this place. I prefer this location as it has a large bar area and we enjoy sitting at the bar. Other than everything closing so early in Tega Cay this place rocks. Fresh street food and way cheap for the quantity and quality .. we love it !

X5-LHP3MzeTABDiMsed6lw.text: I ordered through DoorDash and they sent me the wrong order. I had ordered chicken quesadillas and got cheese quesadillas. When I called the restaurant they didn't take any ownership or accountability for the mistake, instead just blaming DoorDash.  I don't care whose mistake it was, someone needs to own it. Blaming someone else isn't the answer.

EmqnXkrsvgMKLTVKXpZEyw.text: I paid $10 for a shrimp quesadilla and a whole piece didn't have shrimp on it. There were probably 6 shrimp total. The description said meat and cheese and it was full of onions and tomatoes. This location is better than some of the others Ive been to but the last two times were disappointing. People have allergies you can just add random stuff to someones food and not tell them. The onions and tomatoes also made it soggy. The last time I ordered it I added avocado and it was shrimp, cheese and avo, apparently now its supposed to have onions and tomatoes... Also last time I went there the queso was hard.

photos.caption: Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Where is the shrimp?
Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States

XS14ApcsDCgkrjtopLdKog.text: The food & service is always amazing! We enjoy the "kids eat free Wednesday's" as well! Keep up the good work :)

EV3DEdai_X3ZVRtcGvfN-g.text: Salty and overpriced. I have been several times and unfortunately I always feel I ate a salt block. The nachos portion is huge but no value or flavor in the tacos.  Good mix of salsa choices.

J58r9dsDe4Vuax8jSXyYXw.text: We got food to go.  The price were higher then we anticipated, as well as the small amount of protein. Appears to be a food-truck menu, but in a building. Not sure if we will return, but my husband did enjoy the loaded fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Menu
Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Menu
Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Menu

JNv3F0Mj7JYc3VC65R24eA.text: Everything you love about the Elizabeth location PLUS A BAR (and much easier parking). That's right, not only can you get your pineapple habanero salsa fix, but you can also belly up to the bar and grab a beer (8 drafts or bottle/can) or wine (no liquor yet, but they're working on it).   The fella and I made the mistake of going on a Wednesday, which is kids eat free night, and the noise level was mucho loud, but we were able to get a little peace in the corner at the bar. Aaahhh. It was slam packed, which could be because of the free kids' meals... or most likely just because it's Sabor. I branched out from my usual tacos autenticos and tried the empanada with beef, and it was divine. We had a coupon for a free empanada, so two tacos, a basket of chips, a beer, and a cider only cost us $20.  Delicious AND cheap AND a bar AND easy parking? Perfecto!!

iq4HX94TAxkm7oN7xerG_A.text: Cheap, great margaritas, great and many different salsas, and great food. One of my favorite local spots

wU-z3h5jlbMPqeseLp9AYA.text: My wife decided to give Sabor another try and brought some take-out food home - two burrito bowls. We paid for several add-on items but could not find any of them among the rice and beans.   We also paid to add extra protein to the bowls and I had a total of nine small pieces of chicken in my bowl. Very disappointing.   Sabor just isn't good value or quality for the money.   Twice burned. We won't return.

photos.caption: Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States

Baf0hcGjasAdIe98toB85g.text: sticky tables but good food!! Alex R, dishwasher, made the experience 5 stars.  Unforgettable to say the least. Sabor is now my absolute favorite Tega Cay/Fort Mill establishment. Thank you Alex!!

8vLSDRSjCGzLNaKY1nLYxg.text: Food is good but service sucks. The employees need to go work at the Sabor in Elizabeth for a week and learn how to do speed things up. I waited 23 minutes for 6 tacos. The place wasn't busy. No one was in line. Tables weren't even 1/3 full.

YxNZqXpyD6yBl4nZlIiNDw.text: Love the food. Not authentic Mexican food but still good quality. I like their carne asada fries.

BI0D1bWmJPwPcQ9eRo1OpQ.text: Quite a bit disappointed, I used to love getting food here all the time and specifically at this location. I stopped getting burritos as often as I used to because most of the time they were missing an ingredient (usually queso, which I usually order and pay extra for) I just mobile ordered, had specified that I wanted my extra queso in the side (just Incase there was none on the burrito so if at least have a side of it even though I'd be paying extra), when I picked it up there was no extra side of queso like I had asked and as expected, no queso in my burrito. I used to love this location and this restaurant. I'd come here regularly with my boyfriend and it got to the point we would always get burritos and the employees recognized us. Then the burritos stopped having consistency and weren't as good. Stopped getting them as much. Stopped coming as much. Still the same.

n-rwRJK0NroUmxJFGV2Zjw.text: The tacos here are so good, especially on Tuesdays when they're only $1. Nothing's better than $1 tacos. I've also tried the elote, nachos, and carne asada fries which all taste great also but the tacos are the real star of the restaurant. This particular location is tiny and gets pretty packed around dinner time on $1 taco night so going early is advised.

7Jao20vLaptjNHFvr7_e_g.text: Not really impressed by the food and welcoming of the staff upon entering.  The food is mediocre to other places.  Tip for the kitchen staff if reheating ground beef please make sure it's heated thoroughly... eating pieces of cold meat was very unappetizing.  No food pics on this one as it wasn't worth taking a pic. The salsa bar was watered down unflavored sauces.   Never again will I go back.

ss-9dKLAhMF2z7RtvlWfbA.text: Great place. Great staff. The food is delicious. Menu has some interesting items  I went here 3 times in the first month I discovered it. Was excited about this place I wouldn't recommend taco Tuesday. The last time we went they forgot our order. They were out of chicken. We had to go get our own drinks the first time   It may have been their first one so maybe they weren't ready for that sort of volume and we did get their later in the evening  The manager came out and talked to us and took care of the situation we had well.  Highly recommend. The one night seemed to be just a bad night but worth mentioning

s9rbQ4yNxdKoEmIBkfR5SA.text: Sabor - delicious in espanol!  And that it was!  My first time in & I was greeted by Richard the Manager. He walked me through the taco selection and I went with two of the grilled shrimp tacos and they were delicious.   I know there are many of us who have things we can and can't eat and unfortunately for me, mine are onions and peppers.  Richard said it was not a problem and he made a great suggestion with the shrimp tacos with flour tortillas, shred lettuce and tomatoes. Wow, everything was so fresh and really exceptional.  They have an extensive menu and the $1 tacos for happy hour looks like a winner.  Plenty of free parking and easy in and out intersection.

photos.caption: Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States

SPNWf7U8GOZ5sEUBD5Y0Sg.text: Went to Sabor last night (Friday Night). They said they were closing and going to a limited menu and transitioning to a bar? WTF... Closing normal business at 9 on a Friday night? I like the food and I'm a regular there but this was so lame. Someone there made this lame decision...bummer  A Bar really...LoL Good luck with that.

cxAMJopHJ9pFLCjyPAKJWg.text: Pretty good food, usually hits the mark. Kids eat free Wednesday, good beer selection, friendly staff, lots of salsas to chose from. Good stuff.

PsQ4biBLmn8oA46veYb4gg.text: Thought I would give the place another shot  the service and cleanliness have been awful for a long time that's why it has been awhile since getting a takeout order. I was shocked when I got home to find 2 ounces of Spanish rice for $1.49 very disappointing

photos.caption: Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Small side of rice for $1.49 r

2AaoAfgxJo_7SHKIBV-1Wg.text: Good place for your standard Tex-Mex faves. This is one of their larger locations so, go ahead, and bring your friends and family. Not to mention six choices of salsa that will fit all taste buds across the board.   We got the chicken nachos. When it first got delivered it appeared lacking some color. The server quickly came back and mentioned that there were items missing, took it back and quickly returned with a mound of lettuce, sour cream, pico de gallo & guacamole with a little more queso.  HUGE difference. So pics may not be True to how they would have served it if all the other stuff was not left out. It was quite tasty!!  Tuesdays are great as it is $1 tacos all day long. They are a little bland so taking advantage of the limes (provided) and salsa station is a must. But they are a buck so you know.  And they have select brews on special, which is always nice. They have a few local crafts too. Good place to go if you do not feel like cooking and want to unwind from the day throwing back a few brews.

photos.caption: Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. And with... chicken nachos
Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Without all the fixins&#39;

C_odaaJ4_yPFFsh2kkWLzQ.text: Excited to have Sabor closer to me.. Of the 4 locations that I went too. This is the biggest.   Came on a Sunday afternoon. They're a bit quiet since the place was empty. As usual I had their Americanos steak tacos, their loco corn and sweet plantains.. All are what I expected. Since I ordered these before..   Customer Service: 3/5 they were all ok. Nothing to it.. Not very personable and delivers our food accordingly.   Resturant: 4/5 overall very clean.. There's no one after we were half way thru our meals but I know the tables were left unclean after customers left..   I do enjoy Sabor. Have the pleasure of meeting the owners at a Yelp event. So I know they care about the kind of foods they put out. So I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Favorite: their corn and steak Americanos tacos
Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Plantains and chips
Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Sweet plantains

xASslEqEN1mVQxYoukEqMA.text: I have to say I am very disappointed with this place.   New to the area and tried this place for our Mexican fix. I saw it had multiple locations so they must be doing something right. Maybe that's the other locations as this is probably one of the worst Mexican meals I've ever had.   The chips were OK at first until the top layer of strategically placed decent unbroken chips were gone. Then it was tiny shards of broken chips as big as a quarter. It can't be an accident that the top chips were good and the ones underneath were smashed up.   I ordered the "sabor especiale". By my understanding "especiale" means "special". What was special about this was absolutely "nada". Poorly seasoned and lacking taste and it would appear they wrapped it with their feet as the wrap barely overlapped at the edges.   The wife ordered rapa el pastor which was OK. Nothing special and two fish tacos. The fish tacos were OK except for the fact the tortillas were torn and just fell apart when trying to pick them up which doesn't really make it a taco.   Maybe it was an off day for them but I doubt we'll be in a rush to return which is a shame seeing as it's just up the street from us.

photos.caption: Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Look nice but the tortilla was rubbish. Fell apart when I picked it up.
Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Badly wrapped tasteless burrito. I think they wrapped it with their feet.
Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Seriously. These are the chips you serve? I&#39;ve picked bigger and better chips out of my beard.

5wf9bmx0V4dH8Ru-ms0xRQ.text: Been here a couple of times and the tacos authenticos and burrito are delicious.  Always get the Plantains too and always good!

X47EU-BdFjY5ttmz9WJc8Q.text: I've been wanting to try here for awhile because I've heard some good things about it. When we came in it was definitely different than I expected. I didn't realize that we weren't seated or anything and no one really greeted us so we didn't realize we should come up to the counter to order, but we figured it out. The food did not disappoint. The carne asada fries had really well cooked steak, perfectly crispy fries, and all the toppings were perfect. I really enjoyed my tacos and the chorizo and everything else in my Taco Locos with grilled chicken was really good but I heavily enjoyed my Taco Americanos with steak a lot more. I definitely want to come back here and try more things on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Taco Salad
Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Carne Asada Fries
Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Tacos Autenticos

Z9kYy7zH7EjZrQJ7wSecZA.text: This was our first time coming here and we were not expecting to have to walk up and order at the counter like a fast food place. There was no sign or anything to make us think that's what we needed to do when we first walked in and no one greeted us. The food was good and came out quick. Everything was very filling. We checked in on yelp when we first got there and saw we could get free chips with our order. When we were getting our drinks before even finding a table one of the boys that worked there asked if we were gonna get any of the salsas so he could clean it up. He ended up leaving them out for us but I just didn't understand why he was trying to clean up so early before they closed with multiple tables of guests still in the restaurant. Anyway, I'll probably come back since the food was good but I'll either come much earlier in the day or get it to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Carne Asada Fries
Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Taco Salad
Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States

E2-53LSLwck5M8xEAhB-Cg.text: Latin style counter service in Tega Cay. Located in a strip mall in Tega Cay, Sabor is a neat little concept. When you walk inside it's actually quite spacious and has an industrial vibe. It's counter service but after you order they give a number and bring your order to you when it's ready. I ordered the carne asada fries which basically amounted to French fry nachos. The fries were fresh and the steak was well seasoned and tender. It was also topped guacamole, sour cream, salsa, and cheese. It all came together quite well. They also have a full service bar. All in all, I definitely recommend a stop in if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Carne asada fries

vJWDzBIK6qElbat9FS9s2Q.text: Very tasty meals here. I ate the quinoa avocado bowl and the kids got chicken tenders and chicken tacos. Everyone loved what they got and we did not have any left overs. This is rare because my kids don't usually like new places we eat at. My quinoa bowl was fresh and delicious. I added the shrimp to it, which was done just right on the grill. We had a great overall experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Menu
Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Restaurant
Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Quinoa Avocado Bowl

yjR9osyh-4HwL4uAPFd43w.text: Really liked the carne Assad fries and their tacos. Had some good margaritas as well. Nice to be able to come to get a good meal and have it be kid friendly.

Em61Ocr4QSEhhe1NzO3VpQ.text: The food is bomb! Add Cilantro Lime Yogurt to whatever you get. $1 tacos on Tuesday all day keeps me coming back. Don't forget to check in for free chips. This location has a bar area so it's my fave location. Salsa bar is delish (I like to mix the pineapple salsa with the mild). Other foods I like are Carne Asada Fries and Chorizo Empanada. Mike was my bartender and he's a personable guy. The staff is much better now as they have made some changes. #lovemesomesabor

PoAqkHcHU7zIGPtM-IWy9w.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat at lunch. It's quick service and awesome Latin food. Love the plantains!

0N8L0vEL-d2ZArq4AGo3ow.text: When this location first opened, I literally walked out because it was crowded and the line was super long and there was nowhere to sit. After standing in line for about five minutes and not moving, we walked out.   I'm glad to say this is not the case any more. We decided to give it a second try for Taco Tuesday. We were able to order right away. Staff was friendly and explained some of the menu items. I think about three people came to ask us how our food was. On Tuesdays, the tacos autenticos are $1 which is a really good deal. I got three shredded chicken and my free chips for checking in. The hubby also got tacos and loaded nachos.   The tacos were good, but are messy to eat. Seriously grab some napkins. There is a lot of meat on each taco. The shredded chicken was seasoned nicely. For me, the chopped onions were too many for me since I get a headache after eating raw onions sometimes. So in the future, I'll order them without. I liked the salsa bar. My favorite is the pineapple habenero,  a good blend of sweet and heat.   I tried some of the nachos and they were good. The nachos themselves are not greasy and have a good crunch. The toppings were all delicious. I appreciated the guac and the queso was nice and melty. It was a huge portion.   This location used a lot of the furniture from the previous burger place. If you are a bigger person, the chairs can be uncomfortable.

photos.caption: Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Nachos
Photo of Sabor Latin Street Grill - Fort Mill/Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Shredded Chicken Tacos

WRwVk17vHj6Mq1QRMn1y-g.text: First, let me preface this that I a few months ago I ate at the NoDa location and also was not impressed with that one. I finally made a return visit to Fort Mill/Tega Cay, and I must say, after the hype has died down, it was better. I got a burrito bowl which had a lot of flavor to it and was reasonably priced. The queso in it was delicious. The place was much cleaner this time too - no nastiness on the floor or around the salsa. Service was quick and friendly. The only negative was that they ran out of cheese for the elote, but at 7:00 p.m on Sundayy, I can forgive that. I'll be back.

zp4OYPBLu64zPiLKCGOuBw.text: I got their nachos and they were huge and yummy. Kids eat free on Wednesday's so we saved a $ checking it out then. My husband said his burrito was one of the best (chorizo) burritos he's ever had - which was a pretty impressive statement.

TU-TAtU2SLj3hhMThTpEGA.text: Came in the other night , and received the best serves from an African American girl with two braids ! She was so friendly and smiled the whole time ! Even tho my order was wrong , and the managers was trying to rush me out due to the about to close ! I would rate them a two stars but since the young lady did so well , I'm rating 5 ! The managers are not trained to manage, just trained to rush customer out ! But the young lady made my order correct and my husband loved it thanks to  the young lady .

LhRacVJGXYtdFo7uPOoazQ.text: Great service, friendly staff. Nachos were delicious! Food is fresh and authentic, reminds me of some of the food trucks in Austin, TX. Will definitely be back!
